newsitem.title: USA: Dayton Hudson sees very strong Q3 earnings.
newsitem.headline: Dayton Hudson sees very strong Q3 earnings.

text.p: Retailer Dayton Hudson Corp, which operates 1,104 stores in 38 states, said Thursday it expects very strong earnings for its fiscal third quarter.

"Sales at all of our divisions were ahead of plan in October, with the sales strength at Target due in part to the shift in Halloween," said Bob Ulrich, chairman and chief executive officer, in a statement.
"Our profit momentum in the first half of the year has continued at both Target and Mervyn's, and as a result, we expect yet another period of very strong earnings for the third quarter," he said.

Dayton Hudson reported its October comparable store sales rose six percent from the same month a year ago. Total sales for the four weeks ended November 2, 1996 increased 12.3 percent to $1.89 billion from $1.68 billion a year ago.

Target's total sales for the month increased 17.4 percent and comparable-store sales increased 9.6 percent. Mervyn's total sales for the month increased 0.1 percent and comparable-store sales decreased 0.9 percent. The Department Store Division's total sales for the month increased 5.6 percent and comparable-store sales decreased 0.4 percent.
